chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 147 sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cour costs ($268), DNA surcharge ($250) and Child pornograhy surcharge ($5,000) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment. AMENDED 04-22-2015:  Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment.

Sex offender treatment.
Not ot use or possess any pornography.
Not to use or have access to the internet except for work and only with Agents approval.
Not to maintain or have access to anyone else's internet accounts (email, facebook, pinterest, etc.).
Sex Offender Registry.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No unsupervised contact with any minor children.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Attorney Michael Holzman.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn and A.D.A. Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Keith T Johnson in court, in custody ( Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Michael S. Holzman.    

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
Count 2:
Total Prison: 6 Years.
Initial Confinement: 3 Years.
Extended Supervision: 3 Years.
147 Days Credit

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Sex offender treatment.
Not to use or possess any pornography.
Not use or have access to the internet accept for work and only with agents approval.
Not to maintain or have access to anyone else's internet accounts (e-mail, facebook, pinterest, etc..)
Sex Offender Registry.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No unsupervised contact with any minor children.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
Surcharge (for 10 pornographic images):  $5,000
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.


Defendant to be transferred to D.C.I. - FORTHWITH
Pending Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on December 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
